com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.json
Class JsonParser

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.prmf.merapi.json.JsonParser

public class JsonParser
extends Object

Parses text in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format as Java objects.

Author:
Miorel-Lucian Palii

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a new JSON parser.

Method Detail

parse

public JsonValue parse(CharSequence json)
                throws JsonException
Parses a character sequence in JSON format.

Parameters:
json - a character sequence in JSON format
Returns:
a Java object representation of the input
Throws:
JsonException - if a problem occurs during parsing

parseArray

protected Pair<JsonArray,Integer> parseArray(CharSequence json,
                                             int start)
                                      throws JsonException
Parses a JSON array starting at the specified position.

Parameters:
json - a character sequence in JSON format
start - the index at which parsing should start
Returns:
a JSON array and the number of characters parsed, as a pair
Throws:
JsonException - if a problem occurs during parsing

parsePair

protected Triple<String,? extends JsonValue,Integer> parsePair(CharSequence json,
                                                               int start)
                                                        throws JsonException
Parses a JSON name/value pair starting at the specified position.

Parameters:
json - a character sequence in JSON format
start - the index at which parsing should start
Returns:
a name, a JSON value, and the number of characters parsed, as a triple
Throws:
JsonException - if a problem occurs during parsing

skipWhitespace

protected int skipWhitespace(CharSequence text,
                             int index)
Finds and returns the smallest index in the text not lesser than the one given containing a non-whitespace character.

Parameters:
text - the text to check
index - the starting index
Returns:
the first index in the text no lesser than the given one containing a non-whitespace character, or the maximum of the input and the length of the text, if there are no non-whitespace characters at or past the given index

subSequenceEqualsIgnoreCase

protected boolean subSequenceEqualsIgnoreCase(CharSequence text,
                                              int start,
                                              String goal)
Checks if the text matches the goal string case-insensitively starting at the specified position.

Parameters:
text - the text to check
start - the starting position in the text
goal - the goal string to match against
Returns:
true if there is a match, false otherwise

assertChar

protected void assertChar(CharSequence text,
                          int index,
                          char expected,
                          String errMsg)
                   throws JsonException
Asserts that the character in the given text at the specified index matches the expected value and throws an exception with the specified detail message if it does not.

Parameters:
text - the text to check
index - the index of the character to check
expected - the expected value of the character
errMsg - detail message of the exception which will be thrown if the character does not match the expected value
Throws:
JsonException - if the index is outside the bounds of the text, or the character at that index doesn't match the expected value

isNumeric

protected boolean isNumeric(char c)
Check if the given character can occur in a string which is the JSON format representation of a number. Therefore here "numeric" has a broader definition because the plus and minus sign, exponent indicators, and the decimal point will pass, in addition to the digits 0 through 9.

Parameters:
c - the character to check
Returns:
true if the given character is "numeric", false otherwise

parseValue

protected Pair<? extends JsonValue,Integer> parseValue(CharSequence json,
                                                       int start)
                                                throws JsonException
Parses a JSON value starting at the specified position.

Parameters:
json - a character sequence in JSON format
start - the index at which parsing should start
Returns:
a JSON value and the number of characters parsed, as a pair
Throws:
JsonException - if a problem occurs during parsing
